clinical_study.brief_title: Intraabdominal Hypertension and Occurrence of Microaspiration in Cirrhotics Under Mechanical Ventilation
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Intraabdominal Hypertension on Microaspiration Incidence in Cirrhotic Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The study aims to demonstrate the relationship between intra-abdominal hypertension (IAH) and abundant microaspirations in mechanically ventilated cirrhotic.

detailed_description.textblock:
Intra-abdominal pressure monitoring will be performed using intra-vesical pressure every 8 hour in the first 2 days of mechanical ventilation.
Micro aspiration is defined by pepsin or amylase positivity in trachea suction. Two groups will be compared : one with IAH , one without IAH.

primary_outcome.description: presence of pepsin or alpha amylase at significant level in at least 30% of tracheal aspirates

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from intubation until day 28 or extubation
from intubation until day 28 or extubation
secondary_outcome.description: number of days with mechanical ventilation

secondary_outcome.measure: incidence of patients requiring renal replacement therapy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from ICU admission until Day 28 or ICu discharge, whichever came first
secondary_outcome.description: percentage of patients with renal replacement treatment

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from ICU admission until Day 28 or ICU discharge, whichever came first
secondary_outcome.description: percentage of patients with cirrhosis related complications

arm_group.description: patients with intraabdominal hypertension defined as intravesical pressure more than 12 mmHg

study_pop.textblock: cirrhotic patients receiving invasive mechanical ventilation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- adult patients
- Cirrhosis
- intubation and mechanical ventilation
Exclusion Criteria:
- pregnancy
- oliguric patients
- impossibility to measure intravesical pressure
